question_text: Read the following text and answer the Question Nos. 1 to 6: [Passage about the algorithmic theory of beauty...]. According to the algorithmic theory:
options: (A) subjective perceptions of observers' cannot be systematically classified
(B) there is no correlation between subjective observation and beauty
(C) there is a positive correlation between beauty and minimum description

question_text: The formal language of mathematics
options: (A) prefers simple proof which may or may not be elaborate
(B) prefers the least elaborate description and repetition
(C) may be complex even as it provides a short description

question_text: The author of the passage suggests that Leonardo da Vinci:
options: (A) was a precursor of the algorithmic theory of information
(B) predicted the algorithmic theory of beauty
(C) produced proportion studies that support algorithmic theory of beauty
(D) gave a theory of subjectively perceived aesthetics

question_text: Which of the following is not true ?
options: (A) What is interesting is not always beautiful
(B) We perceive beauty when we discover symmetry
(D) We can distinguish between what is interesting and what is beautiful

question_text: How do we perceive beauty ?
options: (C) By identifying a pleasing human face

question_text: For which set of values of p, q, P, Q and for which arithmetic operation, the expression: (p/P) * (q/Q) = -1 ?
options: (B) p = P = 1, q = Q = -1 and * is 'x'
(C) p = Q = -1, q = P = 1 and * is '-'
(D) p = q = P = 1, Q = -1 and * is '/'
